snippet: Officials in San Bernardino, Calif., were making headway against violent crime until the economic floor fell out.
abstract: Officials in San Bernardino, Calif, say they were making headway against violent crime until city filed for bankruptcy in Aug 2012; homicide rate has shot up more than 50 percent in five months since, negating steady drop in violent crime in years prior.
lead_paragraph: Officials in San Bernardino, Calif., were making headway against violent crime until the economic floor fell out.

headline.seo: Crime Rises in San Bernardino After Bankruptcy
headline.main: A Poorer San Bernardino, and a More Dangerous One, Too
headline.print_headline: A Poorer San Bernardino, and a More Dangerous One, Too
